column1:
You are cherry picking my comment and it’s rather disingenuous of you.

I clearly said:

 “It’s true. 

The coronavirus was patented in 2015 by The Pirbright Institute that is funded in part by the Gates.”

Then I gave the source link.

I did not mince my words, but you are.

Oh, I see. 

Obviously the patent is for the coronavirus specifically, not mutations there of. I imagine the Wuhan version of the virus would need to be genetically sequenced to determine if it is a mutation of the original virus or of another.

Reading through the actual patent the virus was invented years ago to combat other viruses that afflicted birds, specifically chickens. The coronavirus was used to make vaccines that could be given to the birds to immunize them from a range of already existing viruses.
